description: Allergic Contact Dermatitis is a type of skin reaction that occurs when the skin comes into contact with a substance that the immune system recognizes as foreign and triggers an allergic response. This can result in redness, itching, and swelling of the skin.
possible causes: Exposure to allergens such as nickel, fragrances, or certain chemicals
Repeated contact with irritants like soaps or detergents
symptoms: Swelling or blistering of the skin
treatments: Avoiding contact with the allergen or irritant
